intro: Colymbada toletana var. argecillensis, commonly known as the Toletan marsh bellflower, is a rare and specialized plant species native to specific wetland habitats in southern Europe. It is characterized by its slender, herbaceous stems and clusters of small, bell-shaped blue or violet flowers. The plant thrives in moist, nutrient-poor soils, often found in marshes and along the edges of water bodies. Its leaves are typically narrow and grass-like, adapted to the wet conditions of its environment. Due to habitat loss and environmental changes, this variety is considered endangered and requires conservation efforts to ensure its survival.
